r.s: PHP_CodeSniffer tokenises PHP and JavaScript code and detects violations of a defined set of coding standards.
r.d: PHP_CodeSniffer is a PHP5 script that tokenises and "sniffs" PHP and JavaScript code to detect violations of a defined set of coding standards. It is an essential development tool that ensures that your code remains clean and consistent. It can even help prevent some common semantic errors made by developers.
r.n: - Permission denied errors now stop script execution but still display current errors (feature request #14076) - Added Squiz ValidArrayIndexNameSniff to ensure array indexes do not use camel case - Squiz ArrayDeclarationSniff now ensures arrays are not declared with camel case index values - PEAR ValidVariableNameSniff now alerts about a possible parse error for member vars inside an interface - Fixed bug #13921 : js parsing fails for comments on last line of file - Fixed bug #13922 : crash in case of malformed (but tokenized) php file -- PEAR and Squiz ClassDeclarationSniff now throw warnings for possible parse errors -- Squiz ValidClassNameSniff now throws warning for possible parse errors -- Squiz ClosingDeclarationCommentSniff now throws additonal warnings for parse errors
